content.description: Scramble up some mossy ledges until you reach a short steep section that eventually transitions into slab
content.location: This is the first route on the slab side of the cliff, however it is difficult to see the first bolt unless you climb up a little ways onto the mossy/ledgy lower portion of the cliff

content.protection: small nuts and cam's, nothing bigger than 1 inch
content.location: on the slab side of the cliff, walk down past a sport route.  The seam is fairly continuous from the bottom of the cliff to the top.  It is left leaning and the first available pro is a small section of 1 inch crack about seven feet off the deck.

content.description: Easy slab to a short steep section followed by nice thin friction climbing.  Some beginning leaders might not like the distance between the 3rd and 4th bolts.
content.protection: Bolts with a bolted anchor, this route shares the anchor with the route that starts immediately to the left.
content.location: Fourth bolted route you come to on the slab side.

content.description: Easy slab climbing on decent rock.
content.protection: Bolts and a bolted anchor with chains for lowering or rappeling.
content.location: Go down the right hand trail at the rest stop so that you end up on the slab side of the cliff.  This climb is the third bolted route that you come to.

content.description: Easy slab climbing with a few fun moves through a short steep section
content.protection: Bolts with a bolted anchor, walk off the top
content.location: Second route you come to on the slab side, as you come from the parking lot take the right hand trail down to the beach

content.description: Thoughtful cruxes with mixture of power and technique. Fun route!
content.location: Route to the left of the 10 on the main wall of the crag (east face?).

content.description: Climb off block above the river. Fun but nothing special except for the location.
content.location: Furthest left route on the cliff. Keep walking left from main overhanging routes.

content.description: Slab climb.  Bolts a little run out.  Ground fall potential until the second bolt.
content.protection: Bolts all the way.  The anchor is after the top out and it is two bolts.  So bring biners or walk off.
content.location: Just around the left corner of the main wall.

content.description: V5 boulder problem to hard transition back into 2nd crux of Grease Monkey.

This route is the most right route on the main wall.  It starts out just past the corner.  The move past the first bolt is a pretty hard one, with a big reach.  The last bolt is sketchy, becasue if you miss and fall you will hit a ledge before the rope catches you, and you will probably break yourself.
content.location: far right on the main wall.
